Rules
All mafiascum site rules apply in addition to my own ruleset, i.e. play to win, don't talk about ongoing games, etc.

1. Voting: Votes and unvotes must be in bold to be counted. (Ex: Vote: Dunhamganger.) You do not have to unvote between votes for the next vote to be counted. You may unvote at any time and need not specify who you were voting for.

2.Lynching: Lynches require a simple majority of votes. Once that majority is reached, a lynch is achieved and further votes or unvotes will have no effect.

3. No Lynch: You may Vote: No lynch if you wish to end the day without lynching (herp). No Lynch will also require a simple majority.

4. Deadline: This game will function on a cycle of strict 3-week days. Replacements near deadline will extend that deadline by a maximum of 3 days.

5. Deadline Lynch: When the deadline passes, if no player has a majority of the votes, the player with the most votes will be lynched. If more than one player is tied for the most votes, no lynch will occur

6. Night and Night Actions: Night will last for 72 hours maximum. Night actions not received within those 72 hours will not occur. Night actions will be resolved using Natural Action Resolution.

7. Lurking: Players who sign up in this game are expected to actively post and participate. Players who do not post for 48 hours without prior warning will be prodded. Failure to respond to a prod within 48 hours will result in replacement. Lurking will not be a viable strategy in this game and players who are consistently prodded or post only to avoid being prodded will be replaced at the Mod's discretion.

8. Out-Of-Thread/Beyond-The-Grave Communication: The game is not to be discussed outside the thread unless your role specifically states that you may do so, and then only in the manner stated in your role PM. Don't quote any out-of-thread communications regarding this game in the thread; this includes your role PM. In addition, once you're dead, you may post exactly once more (often called a "Bah" post) before endgame, and it may not contain relevant game content. Any violation of this rule is a modkillable offense.

9. Posting Style: Do not use odd colors, font size,excessive Caps Locks, or excessive images in your posts. Do not be unduly abusive to your fellow players. Do not edit or delete your previous posts. No codes or foreign languages. Failure to meet these criteria will result in warnings and/or replacement. This is my color, IT's MINE!! do not use it

10. V/LA: If you are going to be V/LA, please post in the thread if at all possible. Do not assume that a simple site-wide announcement will suffice. Please treat this game like a commitment and respect the time and enjoyment of your fellow players.

11. Questions, Comments, Concerns: If you have any questions that need to be addressed outside of the thread, please PM me. Otherwise, you may get my attention using either of the following formats: @Jake From State Farm, @Mod.

12. Playing to Win: If at any point I deem you to be playing against your win condition, you will be replaced or modkilled. No exceptions. (I always prefer replacements but if it's something I deem extreme I will modkill)

13. Catch-All: If you seem to be violating the spirit of these rules while operating under the letter of them, I will take appropriate action. Fair warning.

14. Fun: Having fun is by no means mandatory, but I would vastly prefer that each of you have some amount of it. If there's anything I can do to ensure that you do, please do not hesitate to let me know.

15. Modkills: A modkill on Town will end the Day, and a modkill on any kind of scum will keep the Day going

16. At least 1 player will get a VT role pm that looks like this

Sample Vanilla Role PM wrote:Welcome to State Farm Mafia, __________. Your role is Vanilla Townie, you only possess the power to speak your mind and vote. You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is nothing else that can prevent it.

It was another long night for Jake talking to customers about switching their car insurance to State Farm; he even had a charming conversation with an elderly lady who said that she was really annoyed by Flo and the Progressive commercials that she would never even consider them. He got a really good laugh when she admitted she tried to summon a State Farm agent and nothing happened nor did she get a new car to replace her broken one. She reminded him of his grandmother so they had a nice long chat about things since her grandkids don't call or visit her anymore. All of a sudden she heard a strange noise in the background and the line went silent. She called back quickly but the phone just rang and rang and nobody picked up. She immediately hung up and dialed 911 but the dispatcher just chuckled when he heard an old lady say "I think Jake from State farm has been murdered" She got so annoyed and just pleaded with the office to send someone over to the office just to check on him and the office in a condescending tone said he would. The next morning David and Mike were making their way into the office discussing the outcome of the Playoff Game when they noticed Jake's car was still in the parking lot. They thought it was kind of odd as Jake is never there when they arrive so they decide to go by his cube and say hi to him. When they get to his cube they see Jake lying on the floor covered in blood, it seems he was bludgeoned to death by the telephone. David says "This reminds me of that scene in the casino where Joe Pesci beat the dude with the phone" and Mike said, but we are in Bloomington, Indiana, I am pretty sure there is no mafia around here... Right?

And so begins State Farm mafia - There are 13 alive and it takes 7 to lynch.

Good Luck everyone.

Role PMs are being sent out this morning and the game will begin when all 13 have confirmed

With everyone confirmed we can finally start. With 13 alive it takes 7 to lynch.

Deadline is April 5, 2013 at 5:00 PM

GAME ON!

My Thoughts
Spoiler:
I hated the fact this game had so many replacements, I felt overall the game went well once the replacements got settled in and I think hands down Absta nailed this game. I believe he nailed all 3 scum on day 1 and was basically able to get them lynched before he was killed. If I had to pick an MVP of the game it would have to be him. The battle between AP & Dr. Z was annoying and I feel like AP was definitely off his game this time around. I also don't like people lying about their roles, but that's a personal preference. The fact that AP figured out that the neighbors really helped town, I do not think the original members would have figured it out. The unknown about neighbors was supposed to be the wild card. Contrary to what Safety was talking about in the thread, Neighbors are not always randomized, they absolutely can be hand picked.

Nice job by everyone, Scum not getting in their kill night 1 I think hurt them a lot. Depending who they chose could have really changed the game.

Thanks everyone for playing and hopefully I will get my Goonies Theme game in a micro soon. I appreciate any feedback to help me run the game better next time
